summary.text: As a first-year Drama Teacher (provisional), I decided to amalgamate the Comprehensive Middle School Drama curriculum. This approach has allowed me to provide my scholars with a well-rounded introduction to Theatre—including Scenic Design, Theatrical Lighting, and Acting (Meisner Technique). Unfortunately, I did not find the kind of time and resource support I needed to provide a more substantial experience for my scholars. Therefore, I am seeking a school that has or is open to allowing me to build a Theatre Arts program. One of my near-term goals is to develop a traveling troupe that would perform one-act plays throughout and beyond the county.

schools: The American Academy of Dramatic Arts Acting, New York (1999-2000)

entries.text: Using my educational and professional theatrical experience, I have amalgamated the Comprehensive Middle School Drama curriculum to provide my students with a complete introduction to Theatre. My class covers the literary, performance, and technical aspects of Theatre—including stage types, scenic design, theatrical lighting, storytelling, play/script formatting, the Dramatic Play Structure, Acting, and audition techniques.

Upon returning to substitute teaching, I have continued to facilitate the learning process by implementing lesson plans provided by the permanent teacher and assisting students in achieving their academic goals. Additionally, I continue to encourage positive behavior throughout the learning process.
As a Freelance Web Developer, I design and develop user-friendly websites, focusing on building custom features to achieve client goals.

While utilizing various web technologies and frameworks, my responsibilities included building mobile responsive websites, micro-sites, and interactive HTML email templates from design comps (PSDs/Sketch). To ensure performance and cross-browser compatibility, I was responsible for testing, debugging, and site maintenance in preparation for client/vendor delivery.

As a member of the "Digital Channel" team, I created websites for well-known political candidates, campaigns, and advocacy groups. My tasks included developing custom PHP applications, designing graphics, theming WordPress sites, and creating custom plugins and widgets. I also tested and maintained digital assets, and worked with clients and vendors to implement new features.

In my role as a Substitute Teacher for four years, I was responsible for managing the classroom and supporting academic learning. I followed the lesson plans provided by the permanent teacher and assisted students in achieving their learning objectives. I also maintained proper classroom management and encouraged positive behavior to enhance the learning experience.

As part of my role, I oversaw the daily operations of the classroom to support academic learning. I followed the lesson plans set by the permanent teacher and assisted students in achieving their objectives. Additionally, I ensured proper classroom management and encouraged positive behavior throughout the learning experience.

As an Acting Instructor, I taught Acting classes to children aged 7-17. My classes included an introduction to the "Meisner Technique," vocal production, and stage movement, all presented in a fun and engaging way for beginners. To reinforce these techniques, I used theatre games. Additionally, as the Production Director, I directed Musical Theatre International's "Seussical Kids" and "Once On This Island," as well as a series of one-act plays. Finally, as Technical Director, I oversaw the implementation of all technical aspects of the end-of-season production.

subHeading.employer: Journeys Summer Arts Camp (Duke Ellington School of the Arts)

entries.text: As the Program Assistant Director, my responsibilities involved overseeing the afternoon program, managing the administrative team, and organizing staff meetings and camp trips. In my role as Production Assistant Director, I was responsible for supporting the Production Director's vision by coaching the actors, developing characters, refining scenes, and contributing creative ideas. Additionally, as an Acting Instructor, I taught "Method" and "Meisner" acting techniques, character development, and voice techniques for the stage.

As the Artistic Director of the Theatre Program, I developed an Acting and Introduction to Theatre curriculum for campers 6-16 years of age. My subject area responsibilities included teaching all Acting and "Introduction to Theatre" classes, directing an end-of-session musical (Funny Girl), directing weekly short plays, programming talent shows, and teaching basic lighting/set design. My general camp duties included overnight cabin supervision, participating in camp-wide activities, mentoring male campers, and supporting other activities.
